title: Apical ligament of dens
text:
The ligament of apex dentis (or apical odontoid ligament) is a <a href="ligament">ligament</a> that spans between the <a href="axis%20%28anatomy%29">second</a> <a href="cervical%20vertebra">cervical vertebra</a> in the <a href="neck">neck</a> and the <a href="skull">skull</a>.
It lies as a fibrous cord in the triangular interval between the <a href="alar%20ligament">alar ligament</a>s, which extends from the tip of the <a href="odontoid%20process">odontoid process</a> on the <a href="axis%20%28anatomy%29">axis</a> to the anterior margin of the <a href="foramen%20magnum">foramen magnum</a>, being intimately blended with the deep portion of the <a href="anterior%20atlantooccipital%20membrane">anterior atlantooccipital membrane</a> and superior <a href="wiktionary%3Acrus">crus</a> of the <a href="Transverse%20ligament%20of%20atlas">transverse ligament of the atlas</a>.
It is regarded as a rudimentary <a href="intervertebral%20fibrocartilage">intervertebral fibrocartilage</a>, and in it traces of the <a href="notochord">notochord</a> may persist.
